{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3546055,"name":"Tio","username":"Tio","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/d2c977/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T17:07:13.251Z","cooked":"

Hi Everyone

I want to use a winch to lift the robot. Any ideas on how to lock it so the robot does not go down after the match is over? We are using the Andy Mark Climber in a box kit
Climber in a Box Winch Kits - AndyMark, Inc

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T17:07:13.251Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":343,"readers_count":342,"score":158.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"Tio","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/climber-in-a-box-winch-kits?sku=am-4664","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Climber in a Box Winch Kits - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":35}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28847,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546065,"name":"Corbin Kuster","username":"CKioxide","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ckioxide/{size}/235143_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T17:12:54.843Z","cooked":"

We used a CIAB last year (2 actually) and used separate AM transmissions with kraken drive. Even with active braking, we barely stayed up for the whole climb count. This year, although we’re not using a CIAB, we decided to try to 16:1 Ratchet Sport. This worked well for us; we only missed a single climb in all of our matches this weekend, and it was easy to lower while disabled. It doesn’t package as well as a transmission in my opinion, but the ratchet is great.

Ratcheting gearbox i.e. versa planetary rachet

Saw a few teams using the servo variant of the Ratchet Sport to keep from falling down this weekend.

FRC461; FTC4366/6518/19932/21931"},"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/4","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546143,"name":"Lachlan","username":"LachlanN","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lachlann/{size}/225272_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T17:47:55.944Z","cooked":"

Depends on what motor your using but if you have an high enough gear ratio the motor back drive can hold for enough time. We are using a 45:1 gear ratio with a vortex and it stays up long enough.

If you can just use as much friction as possible without interrupting the climb phase

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:18:14.640Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73955,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546211,"name":"Thomas Coen","username":"Tommy5104","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tommy5104/{size}/252252_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T18:24:32.307Z","cooked":"

Easiest way to do this in my opinion is just using a high gear ratio. We use a 125:1 and it stays up in the air for 15+ seconds. Plus the high gear ratio helps the motor have enough power to successfully climb.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:24:32.307Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":32.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"Thomas Coen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64130,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546233,"name":"","username":"Bender","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T18:33:37.853Z","cooked":"

We use exactly this. Last year we had two arms and used a 60:1 ratio for our Neos - this year with a single arm I think we’re using a 100:1 ratio or similar. It stays up on its own after power is cut, don’t need to ratchet or anything.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:33:37.853Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62200,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546272,"name":"Ben Schuler","username":"BenMS","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/e9c0ed/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T18:51:21.948Z","cooked":"

We ran into this issue with our climb this year. We considered using the sport gearbox w/ ratchet, but ended up using a secondary mechanism with a servo and a hook to lock the robot in its “climbed” position. It worked well, so it might be a good option if you don’t want to mess with the gearbox.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:51:21.948Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":129,"readers_count":128,"score":25.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"Ben Schuler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73564,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cad Team & Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546284,"name":"Elkbits","username":"Elkbits","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elkbits/{size}/8480_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T18:58:45.980Z","cooked":"

Latch on a servo

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T18:58:45.980Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":22.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"Elkbits","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25904,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546315,"name":"kieran","username":"taciturnaxolotl","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/taciturnaxolotl/{size}/240907_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T19:16:07.038Z","cooked":"

my team is just banking on a insane 450:1 gear ratio to hold us up . Last year we used CIAB and just used motor breaking and a 20:1 gearbox and it worked okayish. We never fell down but it would start to sag after a few seconds

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T19:16:07.038Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":19.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"kieran","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/11","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546666,"name":"mshafer1","username":"mshafer1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/96bed5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-03T23:19:47.394Z","cooked":"

You might get more views posting this in a build category.

Last time I did a ratchet climb my team used a ratcheting wrench in the drive train upstream of a shifter (which acted as the release).

VEX has an amusing response to that on their product: https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-6048.html?srsltid=AfmBOoq4ptKuI9yKAeaEFLCA56Uu8FcQfVsDwoBNFlg5WRJSPHLeiyhX

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-03T23:19:47.394Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":15.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494010,"topic_slug":"winch-for-lifting-robot","display_username":"mshafer1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-6048.html?srsltid=AfmBOoq4ptKuI9yKAeaEFLCA56Uu8FcQfVsDwoBNFlg5WRJSPHLeiyhX","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24334,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/winch-for-lifting-robot/494010/12","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546905,"name":"Chris_Elston","username":"Chris_Elston","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_elston/{size}/256883_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T02:47:20.014Z","cooked":"

We just use a 1/2 ratchet wrench from your local hardware store on the hex shaft. For climbing it’s usually one way up. Sometimes the the pawl breaks depending on what brand you get from the store. We got “Channel Lock” brand from ACE hardware and it seems to be holding up pretty good.
